ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: repelled with harshness - they will suffer eternal punishment -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And kept far away. There is perpetual punishment for them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and driven away to suffer the necessary torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To make them flee, and for them is a never-ending punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Outcast, and theirs is a constant torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Being driven off, and for them is a perpetual chastisement,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: rejected, and theirs is an everlasting chastisement,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Outcast, and theirs is a perpetual torment;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: driven away, and will suffer eternal punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: With a driving fusillade, and theirs shall be a torment perpetual;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: to drive them away, and there is a perpetual punishment for them—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Repulsed, for they are under a perpetual penalty,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Outcast, and theirs is a constant (or painful) torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They are rejected and theirs is an everlasting punishment;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Repelled—they will have a lingering torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:9] to repel [them] (duhūran is a verbal noun from daharahu, meaning, ‘he repelled him, driving him away’; it is an object denoting reason) and theirs, in the Hereafter, is an everlasting chastisement;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Outcast) they are driven away from heaven and from listening to the angels, (and theirs is a perpetual torment) by means of the stars; and it is also said that this means: in the Fire;
